alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Dallas; Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 3:08AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Autauga, southwestern Elmore, Lowndes, southeastern Dallas and Montgomery Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 307 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Prattville to 6 miles west of Mosses to near Dannelly Reservoir. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. A wind gust to 37 mph was recently recorded at the Selma Airport. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Prattville, Millbrook, Wetumpka, Fort Deposit, Mosses, Hayneville, Meadville, Pike Road, Elmore, Coosada, White Hall, Gordonville, Lowndesboro, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama, Auburn University In Montgomery, Dublin, Autauga County Airport, Woodcrest and Snowdoun. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
